intro: Epidendrum aurimurinus, commonly known as the golden-lipped epidendrum, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质, providing a waxy surface that helps retain moisture. The flowers, which are usually yellow or orange with a distinctive lip, bloom in clusters and attract various pollinators.
